## hpr1727 :: Basic Mutt

 Using a text email client such as Mutt is quite a learning experience.  Here is some information to help you get started.

The programs that Frank used to set up Mutt:

Getting and Sorting Mail:  
Fetchmail https://sourceforge.net/projects/fetchmail/
Procmail and Formail https://www.procmail.org/

Reading and Composing Mail:  Mutt https://www.mutt.org/

Sending Mail:  msmtp https://msmtp.sourceforge.net/

These are the references that Frank found most helpful:

Configuring Mutt:
Quickstart Guide to Mutt: https://docs.huihoo.com/gentoo/resources/document-listing/guide-to-mutt.html

Calmar on Mutt:  https://www.calmar.ws/mutt/
Feeding the Cloud:  Handling multiple identities/accounts in mutt:  https://feeding.cloud.geek.nz/posts/handling-multiple-identitiesaccounts-in/

Procmail (the UMBC link is a great introduction to procmail and procmail's regex):
Mail Filtering with Procmail:  https://userpages.umbc.edu/~ian/procmail.html#example
https://www.linux-mag.com/id/826/

Some Text Browsers (for help in parsing HTML emails)
Lynx https://lynx.isc.org/
Links https://www.jikos.cz/~mikulas/links/
elinks https://elinks.or.cz/
w3m https://w3m.sourceforge.net/
